intro: Seseli nudum var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale purple flowers. The leaves are typically pinnately divided, with a silvery or purplish underside that gives the plant its distinctive appearance. Native to the western United States, it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. This variety is often found in open meadows and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
